intro: Memecylon pseudoangulatum, commonly known as the narrow-angled memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, with distinct sepals and petals. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds.
